channel.title: A warning to all
channel.description:
DO NOT TEST THE WEBCLIENT OR RUN THE JAVA IF Anyone with this email: goldgl0v3r@hotmail.com Or with a site such as: frozen-scape.tk or users9.nofeehost.com/frozenscape
DO NOT VISIT As these are the java drivebys. These infect your computer with multiple files. We are getting rid of it, and I have found a soloution. Do not be fooled by people asking you to beta their server.
We have found a way. Use Norton power eraser FULL ROOT SCAN *requires restart*. This will find it. This is what we did to atomicint_ to get rid of it.
Thank you for reading, I hope this is better and safer for the community.

item.title: A warning to all
item.dc:creator: @baddy351 baddy351
item.description:
@baddy351 wrote:

Low Orbit Ion Cannon, look it up, I will not say what it is on these forums.

item.title: A warning to all
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

[quote=“baddy351, post:31, topic:423286”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=525934.msg3830640#msg3830640 date=1322532315]

Yet The Government (SOPA) Is Trying To Bend An Amendment One Of The Ones That Has Helped This Country (America) So Much The Freedom Of Speech I’m Sure You’ve Heard About The Internet Censorship Right?? They Probably Have A Lot Of Security Especially Since Anonymous Is On Them Like White On Rice (But Not Brown Rice) Yet They Still Manage To Do It To SOPA

Just shut up and go to the corner, Anonymous isn’t a group, it’s an idea/belief. Stop bitching about the internet law, it’s not going to pass, it has been trying to get passed since the internet first came to be and it hasn’t come close to being put into action. It’s just some rich dude with money paying people to look over the bill again. Stop acting like you care about freedom of speech, because I doubt you know the real meaning of freedom of speech.
[/quote]
This.
And LOIC Will do nothing most likely to him. And why the fuck are you talking about things such as LOIC on moparscape, that shit will get you banned faster than you can edit your post.[/quote]
what does LOIC mean

Read full topic

item.title: A warning to all
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

I recommend using malwarebytes antimalware. Update it. And I would do a full scan while in safemode, or while disconnected from the internet.

Another thing to do, use regedit and find the following locations. Remove anything that should not be starting up whenever you turn your computer on. this might not fix the problem, but usually does.

BleepingComputer

Windows Program Automatic Startup Locations

Many programs that you install are automatically run when you start your computer and load Windows. For the majority of cases, this type of behavior is fine. Unfortunately, there are programs that are not legitimate, such as spyware, hijackers,...

Sometimes it’s safer to backup the files you want, and format. +your computer runs like new again.

Read full topic

item.title: A warning to all
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“Acorn_, post:8, topic:423286”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=525934.msg3829844#msg3829844 date=1322484262]

I never use webclients, and I never play any servers that use free hosting sites. It’s dumb to not be cautious when playing RS private servers.

Yeah yeah yeah, you’re perfect we get it.
[/quote]
I was gonna say something along the lines of that. :mad:
However though, I really like your idea but how would one go about developing such a tool?[/quote]
Well we would have to chose a language to start with first, .net frame works would be the fastest way, but then what about our mac and linux users? All we really have to do is think like them, study what common infection area’s are for client. Most of them I’m betting do something to the windows files. Then after we find out a good amount of commonly infected area’s we can set up a scanning that searches for strans of coding that install these, since I doubt all of the people making these can actually code they wont all be unique. Possibly for the webclients we could make something really simple, something that automatically tracks all installations from java related programs on the computer, then removes ones that install to area’s such as system files, and have it report it’s scam back to a database with all other historys of scans so it can learn about whats good and what’s bad (much like how an anti virus works, it collects data on every file). Just a suggestion, most of it probably wont happen as we are an unmotivated community.

Read full topic
